title.narrative: DCM - PROGRAM FOR COVERED BONDS OF GREEK BANKS

description.narrative: The most significant, expected project level impact is derived from improved liquidity and balance sheet stabilization which would benefit the customers of the banks who are severely affected by the banking crisis. In addition, IFC's funding will be used for onlending to mortgage borrowers, who have been facing a liquidity squeeze, as cash starved banks deleverage their portfolios. Beyond the project, the main source of expected market impact is derived from supporting recovery from the crisis and building resilience through re-establishment of sustainable sources of funding on the market from international capital markets, and promoting greater integration of capital markets, both brought about by market enabling and demonstration effect.
